# UIApplicationSupportsTabbedSceneCollection

**Property List Key**

A Boolean value indicating whether an app built with Mac Catalyst supports automatic tabbing mode.

## Discussion

By default, the tabbing mode for an app built with Mac Catalyst that support multiple scenes is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/TabbingMode-swift.enum/automatic]. Starting with macOS 12, you can disable this behavior by adding the [doc://com.apple.bundleresources/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List/UIApplicationSceneManifest/UIApplicationSupportsTabbedSceneCollection] key with a value of [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] to the [doc://com.apple.bundleresources/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List/UIApplicationSceneManifest] key in your app’s `Info.plist` file.

## Multiple windows

- **UIApplicationSupportsMultipleScenes**: A Boolean value indicating whether the app supports two or more scenes simultaneously.

items.description: A Boolean value indicating whether the app supports two or more scenes simultaneously.
items.name: UIApplicationSupportsMultipleScenes
